metadata.name: Verify that System Executable Have Root Ownership
metadata.description:
/bin
/sbin
/usr/bin
/usr/sbin
/usr/local/bin
/usr/local/sbin
All these directories should be owned by the root user. If any directory DIR in these directories is found to be owned by a user other than root, correct its ownership with the following command: 
$ sudo chown root DIR
metadata.rationale:
System binaries are executed by privileged users as well as system services,
and restrictive permissions are necessary to ensure that their
execution of these programs cannot be co-opted.
